result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:51 am 
INCLUDES 19CF340, 20CF158, 20CF524, 22CF261, & 22CF828. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person with Atty Wright Laufenberg. 
VRCW. 
COURT notes 22CF828 needs future date set as it is new file - parties to see JA to set new date. 

SENTENCING HEARING IN 19CF340, 20CF158, 20CF524, & 22CF261. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 19CF340: Ct. 2>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 
In 20CF158: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 
In 20CF524: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 
                   : Ct. 4>>SWH for 1 yr probation. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation>>sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program; Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; no contact with SC unless authorized by agent; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; CC including DNA surcharges (sample already on file). 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit - parties to submit stipulation re: credit at later date if needed. 
COURT has no objection to probation being transferred to deft's home County. 
Adj: 8:58 am
Marathon County Victim Waiver of No Contact Bond Condition- A.K.
